instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no 20v one port
threads.message:
This arrived with minor liquid damage on both usb-c ports with <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> stuck at 5v and <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> goes to 20V and boots the board.

1.1 LDO was missing from <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> so replaced <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>. 1.1 LDO is now restored on <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> but still stuck at 5v. Also replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q3200</TRANSISTOR> but no change. Fuse is good

Redriver chip on other side that doesn't show on board view or schematic looks good.

What to check next?
